headline: Netflix Stock Is Up 40% in 2025 But Wall Street Isn’t Backing Down. Should You Buy NFLX Now?
summary: Netflix stock has increased by 40% in 2025 and by 1,100% over the last 10 years. Here's why NFLX stock is still a good buy right now.

headline: Budweiser Maker Is Teaming Up With Netflix. It Needs a Wider Audience to Boost Slumping Sales.
summary: Amid declining sales of alcoholic beverages, beer giant Anheuser-Busch InBev is partnering with the streaming service to sell more drinks.

raw.headline: Budweiser Maker Is Teaming Up With Netflix. It Needs a Wider Audience to Boost Slumping Sales.
raw.summary: Amid declining sales of alcoholic beverages, beer giant Anheuser-Busch InBev is partnering with the streaming service to sell more drinks.

headline: Netflix signs co-marketing deal with AB InBev
summary: STORY: Netflix and Anheuser-Busch InBev have signed a global marketing deal that pairs the streaming giant's hit shows with the beermaker's popular brands.The partnership, announced Monday, will include campaigns tied to Netflix shows such as UK drama "The Gentlemen" and South Korea's "Culinary Class Wars."It will also feature limited-edition packaging and digital promotions with AB InBev's Budweiser, Stella Artois and Corona beers.AB Inbev will advertise during Netflix’s live events, including the NFL’s Christmas Day broadcast, and collaborate on marquee events like the 2027 Women's World Cup soccer tournament.Netflix's growing push into live sports has given the platform new opportunities to attract sponsorship and advertising from global brands seeking large viewership.The agreement comes as Netflix's advertising business now reaches more than 94 million users globally.Roughly two years into its launch, the ad tier is increasingly seen as a potential growth engine for Netflix.Financial details of the partnership were not disclosed.

headline: Apple, Teradayne, Netflix & AB InBev deal: Trending Tickers
summary: Market Catalysts host Julie Hyman and Yahoo Finance senior reporter Allie Canal track several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including Apple shares (AAPL) breaking into positive territory in 2025, Teradyne's (TER) price target boost, and Netflix (NFLX) establishing a global brand deal with alcohol distributor Anheuser-Busch InBev (BUD). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Elizabeth Stone on what’s next for Netflix — and streaming itself — at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
summary: As Netflix's CTO (and interim CPO), Elizabeth Stone is shaping the future of entertainment for over 300 million members worldwide. She’ll join the Disrupt Stage for a fireside chat at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025.

headline: Netflix Strikes Global Deal With AB InBev to Pair Hit Shows With Beer Brands

headline: Netflix signs co-marketing deal with AB InBev to promote TV shows and beer
summary: The partnership will include campaigns tied to Netflix's shows such as UK drama "The Gentlemen" and South Korea's "Culinary Class Wars," as well as limited-edition packaging and digital promotions.  AB Inbev, which makes Budweiser, Stella Artois and Corona beers, will advertise on Netflix's live shows such as the NFL's Christmas Day broadcast and collaborate on marquee events including the 2027 Women's World Cup soccer tournament.  Netflix's growing push into live sports has given the platform new opportunities to attract sponsorship and advertising from global brands seeking large viewership.

raw.headline: Netflix signs co-marketing deal with AB InBev to promote TV shows and beer
raw.summary: The partnership will include campaigns tied to Netflix's shows such as UK drama "The Gentlemen" and South Korea's "Culinary Class Wars," as well as limited-edition packaging and digital promotions.  AB Inbev, which makes Budweiser, Stella Artois and Corona beers, will advertise on Netflix's live shows such as the NFL's Christmas Day broadcast and collaborate on marquee events including the 2027 Women's World Cup soccer tournament.  Netflix's growing push into live sports has given the platform new opportunities to attract sponsorship and advertising from global brands seeking large viewership.

headline: AB InBev and Netflix Announce Global Brand Partnership
summary: BRUSSELS & LOS GATOS, Calif., September 22, 2025--AB InBev (Euronext: ABI) (NYSE: BUD) (MEXBOL: ANB) (JSE: ANH) and Netflix, Inc. (NASDAQ: NFLX) today announced a global partnership bringing together the world’s most iconic beer brands with one of the world’s most popular entertainment services. The partnership is unprecedented in the global reach and scale of activations across AB InBev’s portfolio of brands.

raw.headline: AB InBev and Netflix Announce Global Brand Partnership
raw.summary: BRUSSELS & LOS GATOS, Calif., September 22, 2025--AB InBev (Euronext: ABI) (NYSE: BUD) (MEXBOL: ANB) (JSE: ANH) and Netflix, Inc. (NASDAQ: NFLX) today announced a global partnership bringing together the world’s most iconic beer brands with one of the world’s most popular entertainment services. The partnership is unprecedented in the global reach and scale of activations across AB InBev’s portfolio of brands.

headline: A Look Back at Consumer Subscription Stocks’ Q2 Earnings: Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) Vs The Rest Of The Pack
summary: Quarterly earnings results are a good time to check in on a company’s progress, especially compared to its peers in the same sector. Today we are looking at Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) and the best and worst performers in the consumer subscription industry.
